tier1_core_data.name: Polygon Zero
tier1_core_data.description: Polygon Zero develops tools for cryptographic verification of blockchain systems including STARKs for proving EVM Execution. Originally Mir Protocol, focused on recursive SNARKs based on Plonk and Halo, now including high-performance STARK implementation (Starky).

smart_contracts.note: Polygon Zero is a ZK proving library/toolkit, not a deployed protocol with smart contracts. The project provides cryptographic tools (Plonky2, Starky) for building ZK proofs, rather than on-chain contracts.
sources: Plonky2 README - describes it as a SNARK implementation library
GitHub repository analysis - primarily Rust libraries, not Solidity contracts

blockchain.note: Polygon Zero develops ZK proving systems (Plonky2, Starky) used for Ethereum verification, particularly for Polygon zkEVM and other Layer 2 solutions
sources: GitHub organization description mentions 'proving EVM Execution'
